  2. Classes and Interfaces

Package com.example.mco2_supermarketsimulator

package com.example.mco2_supermarketsimulator
  • Class
    Description
    Amenity
    This is the abstract class for all Amenities, such as displays and services.
    Brand
    These are the different types of brands for the productTypes, hence a BREAD can come from "Crustory" or "LoafLuxe".
    CheckoutController
    This is the controller for the Checkout Counter, pretty much all the functionality is here.
    Display
    This is the class for Display, it also contains the names of the different products types available.
    DisplayController
    This is the controller for the Display.
    Equipment
    This is the abstract class for the equipment, such as there are two types, the basket and cart.
    Floor
    This is the Floor class, it contains everything that is mainly needed such as the tiles, displays, and services.
    GameController
    GameController class, this is used for controlling the main bulk functionality of the simulator That includes user input, starting up the simulation, running it, and loading in textures Most importantly, it also draws the game objects such as the tiles and the player.
    InventoryController
    This is the controller for the inventory of the player.
    Main
    This is the Main class, where the actual running of the program happens.
    MainMenuController
     
    Product
    This is the Product class, this is what is stored within the displays and can be utilized by the shopper.
    ProductSearchController
    This is the controller for the Product Search, which handles all the functionality basically.
    ProductType
    This is just the different types of products there are.
    Receipt
    This is the receipt class, to have the receipt of the shopper upon checkout.
    Service
    The class constructor of Service, utilizes Amenity as well, this is just a model though.
    ServiceController
    Controller for handling all service interactions.
    Shopper
    This is the class of the Shopper, where all the shopper related things happen, such as movement and interaction.
    Supermarket
    This is the supermarket class, it contains the floors mainly.
    Tile
    This is the constructor for the Tile.
    TileMap
    Tile Map for the construction of the tiles for each floor.
